list: The purpose of this survey is to collect information on management practices and future expectations of businesses in Great Britain.
The information you provide will help to better understand whether management practices and uncertainty are related to productivity, and this could inform government policy.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

content.description: View questions and see examples of how to complete the Expectations section, before you start the survey (external link).
The information required in this survey covers a range of topics, and you might need to consult with colleagues for some sections.
This section asks for information about the management practices and organisational characteristics of your business in both the 2019 calendar year and now (your current practices).
Select the answers that best capture your general management practices across the whole business.
Management practices refers to the working methods that managers use within the business.
This section asks for information about how the business was organised in terms of location and sites in the 2019 calendar year.

This section asks for information about your business's outcomes in 2019 and how current outcomes for 2020 have differed from expectations going in to 2020. We also ask about expectations for how your business, and the wider economy, will operate in 2021.
The questions in this section ask for your expectations for a range of scenarios. Go to this address to see some examples of how to answer these questions
If you do not hold the precise information, please use your best judgement. You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
This section provides the opportunity to request feedback on the management practices score, and provide feedback on the questionnaire.

list: Include information on the activity of the business in England, Scotland and Wales, but exclude Northern Ireland, the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man.
Exclude overseas branches, subsidiaries and agencies.

blocks.title: Management practices and business characteristics
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about the management practices and organisational characteristics of your business in both the 2019 calendar year and now (your current practices).

Select the answers that best capture your general management practices across the whole business.

Management practices refers to the working methods that managers use within the business.

questions.title: Approximately, what was the workforce size of {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} during the following periods?

content.description: Exclude full or part-time contract or temporary staff on the payroll of an employment agency or another company

questions.title: In 2019, in general what was the most common response to problems faced within {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}?

Slow or late delivery of products or services
A piece of technology breaking down

options.value: We resolved the problems and took action to try to ensure they do not happen again

options.label: We resolved the problems and had a continuous improvement process to anticipate similar problems in advance
options.value: We resolved the problems and had a continuous improvement process to anticipate similar problems in advance

We resolved the problems and took action to try to ensure they do not happen again
We resolved the problems and had a continuous improvement process to anticipate similar problems in advance

blocks.title: Organisation
blocks.description: This section asks for information about how the business was organised in terms of location and sites in the 2019 calendar year.

questions.title: In 2019, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} operate across multiple sites in Great Britain?

content.description: This refers to a building or place where one or more employees work for an extended period or regularly throughout the year.

values: No

questions.title: In 2019, where were the decisions on recruiting permanent full-time employees made for {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}?

options.label: Both at individual sites and at headquarters
options.value: Both at individual sites and at headquarters

questions.title: In 2019, where were decisions on new product introductions made?

options.label: Both at individual sites and at headquarters
options.value: Both at individual sites and at headquarters

questions.title: In 2019, what was the maximum amount that could be used to purchase a capital asset for a site without prior authorisation from headquarters?

content.description: A capital asset is an asset used by the business with a useful life of a year or more.

blocks.title: Expectations
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about your business's outcomes in 2019 and how current outcomes for 2020 have differed from expectations going in to 2020. We also ask about expectations for how your business, and the wider economy, will operate in 2021.

The questions in this section ask for your expectations for a range of scenarios. Go to this address to see some examples of how to answer these questions

https://www.ons.gov.uk/surveys/informationforbusinesses/businesssurveys/managementandexpectationssurvey

If you do not hold the precise information, please use your best judgement. You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.

questions.title: What dates in the calendar year 2019 will you be reporting for?
questions.description:
This following section asks for information on financial items.

Where possible, we would like you to report for calendar years. If calendar reporting periods are not available, please use your own financial year reporting period that spans the majority of the calendar year in question.

If you traded for only part of the year, please still provide dates and figures for the period in which you were trading.

Please indicate below what dates you will be reporting for when questions ask for the 2019 calendar year.

questions.title: What was {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s turnover for the following periods?
questions.description: Report to the nearest £1,000. For example, £1,357,689 would be reported as £1,358,000

list: all sales of goods (except capital assets) including exports and goods purchased and resold without processing
income from any services rendered to other organisations, except the rent from land
amounts received for the right to use patents and similar
provision of goods or services to other parts of your company or organisation which are not the same as the part of your company you are responding for
goods and services produced and used by your business (output for own final use)
amounts received from the sale of fixed capital assets or intellectual property rights
grants, subsidies from any public authority, transfers and donations
freight charges, excise taxes and value added tax

answers.label: 2020 turnover
answers.description: Approximate or expected turnover is acceptable

questions.title: Approximately, what percentage of {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s turnover came from online sales in the following periods?

questions.title: Looking ahead to the 2021 calendar year, what is the approximate turnover you would anticipate for this business in the following scenarios?
questions.description:
We would like to know what you expect your business's turnover will be in 2021. However, as it is difficult to predict a single figure, we would like you to think about five possible scenarios, from the lowest turnover scenario to the highest, with your best estimate in the middle.

We would like to know how likely you think each of these scenarios is, and report the probability chance of that scenario happening on the next page.

Go to this address to see some examples of how to answer this question:

https://www.ons.gov.uk/surveys/informationforbusinesses/businesssurveys/managementandexpectationssurvey

Please report according to your best judgement, you can provide a rough estimate.

list: all sales of goods (except capital assets) including exports and goods purchased and resold without processing
income from any services rendered to other organisations, except the rent from land
amounts received for the right to use patents and similar
provision of goods or services to other parts of your company or organisation which are not the same as the part of your company you are responding for
goods and services produced and used by your business (output for own final use)
amounts received from the sale of fixed capital assets or intellectual property rights
grants, subsidies from any public authority, transfers and donations
freight charges, excise taxes and value added tax

answers.label: Lowest turnover
answers.description: Report to the nearest £1,000. For example, £1,357,689 would be reported as £1,358,000

questions.title: For the approximate turnover values you have just given for 2021, how likely do you think each scenario is to occur?
questions.description:
Report against your approximate 2021 turnover values:

Lowest: {{ format_currency(answers['answer896c54c2-64da-4e56-a80a-7b2fb85241b0'], 'GBP') }}

Low: {{ format_currency(answers['answerfb01f4d9-c4dc-42e9-aff7-56d1de75acb7'], 'GBP') }}

Medium: {{ format_currency(answers['answered849a4d-2006-42c0-8759-16b37d35bad3'], 'GBP') }}

High: {{ format_currency(answers['answerb234b135-c4f7-417b-90df-e5825f8ea906'], 'GBP') }}

Highest: {{ format_currency(answers['answer31b16579-20ca-459a-bb95-7c26c1f93b03'], 'GBP') }}

Answers should add up to 100%

definitions.title: How you might answer this question

content.description: We would like to know what you expect your business’s turnover will be in 2021. However, as it is difficult to predict a single figure, we would like you to think about five possible scenarios, from the lowest turnover scenario to the highest, with your best guess in the middle. We would like to know how likely you think each of the scenarios you gave in the last question are, and report the probability chance of that scenario happening on this page.
Go to this address to see some examples of how to answer this question:

questions.title: What was {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s total expenditure on energy, goods, materials and services for the following periods?
questions.description:
Give amounts payable excluding employment costs, stock variation and all interest payments.

State the net cost of purchases made whether or not they were used or resold.

Report to the nearest £1,000. For example, £1,357,689 would be reported as £1,358,000

list: raw materials used in your production process
other goods and materials, for example office materials and machine spares
general business services and other external services, for example recruitment and travel, accountants, marketing, repairs or maintenance and cleaning
in the case of imports the cost should include import and excise duties
amounts payable for right to use patents and similar
transfers of goods to your business from other parts of the company

answers.label: 2020 expenditure
answers.description: Approximate or expected turnover is acceptable

questions.title: What impact did changes to your supplier network in 2020 have on business operations?
What was {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s total capital expenditure for the following periods?
questions.description:
This covers building work, acquisitions or disposals of land, buildings, structures, vehicles, plant and machinery, and capitalised intangible assets like software, and research and development costs in the UK.

Do not deduct any amounts received in grants and/or allowances from government sources.

list: all additions, alterations and similar which prolong the service life or increase the productive capacity of existing capital
all expenditure on computer software to be used for more than one year
the total capital value of any assets that you have bought on hire purchase or acquired (as lessee) under a finance leasing arrangement
expenditure on assets acquired for hiring, renting and leasing purposes
capital expenditure at any site belonging to the business where operations have not yet begun
all expenditure on dwellings but include land intended for new dwellings
assets like goodwill, patents or licence fees
items of a capital nature acquired for re-sale rather than for use within the business

answers.label: 2019 total capital expenditure
answers.description: Report to the nearest £1,000. For example, £1,357,689 would be reported as £1,358,000

answers.label: 2020 total capital expenditure
answers.description: Approximate or expected capital expenditure is acceptable

questions.title: Looking ahead, approximately how many employees would you anticipate to be on {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s payroll in December 2021 in the following scenarios?
questions.description:
We would like to know what you expect your business’s employment will be in 2021. However, as it is difficult to predict a single figure, we would like you to think about five possible scenarios, from the lowest employment scenario to the highest, with your best estimate in the middle.

We would like to know how likely you think each of these scenarios is, and report the probability chance of that scenario happening on the next page.

Go to this address to see some short examples of how to answer this question:

https://www.ons.gov.uk/surveys/informationforbusinesses/businesssurveys/managementandexpectationssurvey

Please report according to your best judgement, you can provide a rough estimate.

questions.title: For the approximate number of employees you have just given for December 2021, how likely do you think each scenario is to occur?
questions.description:
Your answers should add up to 100%

Report against your approximate December 2021 number of employees:

Lowest: {{ answers['answerce8b197d-2367-4df9-acc3-fedb9585a64a'] | format_number }}

Low: {{ answers['answerf9549ad1-360c-4799-aefb-0c8ac14ad60a'] | format_number }}

Medium: {{ answers['answerd318fcca-c1f9-4402-9214-e3313ebc1c68'] | format_number }}

High: {{ answers['answerb4834a61-c51e-4347-a731-3e8363fdcabc'] | format_number }}

Highest: {{ answers['answer7368e1e7-fb91-4b48-bfbf-2df62b4e6ff1'] | format_number }}

definitions.title: How you might answer this question

content.description: We would like to know what you expect your business’s employment will be in 2021. However, as it is difficult to predict a single figure, we would like you to think about five possible scenarios, from the lowest employment scenario to the highest, with your best guess in the middle. We would like to know how likely you think each of the scenarios you gave in the last question are, and report the probability chance of that scenario happening on this page.
Go to this address to see some short examples of how to answer this question:

answers.label: Likelihood of lowest number of employees occurring
Likelihood of low number of employees occurring
Likelihood of medium number of employees occurring
Likelihood of high number of employees occurring
Likelihood of highest number of employees occurring

questions.title: What likelihood would you give to the following scenarios happening to the UK economy growth rate (GDP), for 2021?
questions.description: Your answers should add up to 100%

definitions.title: What we mean by "UK economy growth rate"

content.description: This is the growth rate of GDP which is the main measure of the size of the UK economy, based on the value of goods and services produced in a given period.

blocks.title: Feedback
blocks.description: This section provides the opportunity to request feedback on the management practices score, and provide feedback on the questionnaire.

questions.title: Would you like to receive {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s management practices score?
questions.description:
To show our appreciation for taking part in this survey, ONS would like to provide your business with its own "management practices" score based on the information you have provided.

Feedback will be sent within two months of the close of the survey.

Your business could use this score to compare against aggregated published data specific to your industry.

Alternatively, you can search "Management Practices" at www.ons.gov.uk where you will find the methods used to produce the score, and calculate independently.

options.label: Yes, I would like to receive feedback
options.value: Yes, I would like to receive feedback

options.label: No, I would prefer not to receive feedback
options.value: No, I would prefer not to receive feedback

questions.title: How long did it take you to complete this questionnaire?

list: the time taken to become familiar with the questionnaire
the time of everyone who helped you to complete the questionnaire
the time spent extracting and preparing information from your systems
any other time spent in relation to completing the questionnaire

questions.title: Please provide any additional information that will help us understand the answers you have provided
